intro: Otolepis alata, commonly known as the winged papyrus, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its most distinctive feature is the presence of wing-like structures on the lower part of the stem, which give it its common name. Otolepis alata typically grows in wet or marshy habitats and is often found in riparian zones.
